SNIP algorithm

Source: R/baseline.R
SNIP.Rd

SNIP algorithm

SNIP(x, LLS = FALSE, decreasing = FALSE, k = 100)

Arguments

x

A numeric vector.
LLS

A logical scalar: should the LLS operator be applied on x before employing SNIP algorithm?
decreasing

A logical scalar: should a decreasing clipping window be used?
k

An integer value giving the numerber of iterations.

Value

A numeric vector.

References

Morháč, M., Kliman, J., Matoušek, V., Veselský, M. and Turzo, I. (1997). Background elimination methods for multidimensional gamma-ray spectra. Nuclear Instruments and Methods in Physics Research Section A: Accelerators, Spectrometers, Detectors and Associated Equipment, 401(1), p. 113-132. DOI: 10.1016/S0168-9002(97)01023-1

Morháč, M. and Matoušek, V. (2008). Peak Clipping Algorithms for Background Estimation in Spectroscopic Data. Applied Spectroscopy, 62(1), p. 91-106. DOI: 10.1366/000370208783412762

Ryan, C. G., Clayton, E., Griffin, W. L., Sie, S. H. and Cousens, D. R. (1988). SNIP, a statistics-sensitive background treatment for the quantitative analysis of PIXE spectra in geoscience applications. Nuclear Instruments and Methods in Physics Research Section B: Beam Interactions with Materials and Atoms, 34(3), p. 396-402. DOI: 10.1016/0168-583X(88)90063-8
